elements.title: Eucalyptus wandoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Noongar used the Eucalyptus wandoo tree (woods pictured) as a medicine and ointment?

elements.title: Ludwig Keke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1968 election, Ludwig Keke defeated Nauru's first female candidate for parliament, his sister Liebon Sunshine Keke?

elements.title: the university's students (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when UCLA was founded in 1919, the university's students provided numerous services, including athletics, housing, and parking?

elements.title: Fuzuli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 16th-century poet Fuzuli wrote a poetic letter titled "Complaint" after Ottoman officials cut his stipend?

elements.title: 23rd Virginia Infantry Battalion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that by September 29, 1864, the 23rd Virginia Infantry Battalion only had 78 enlisted men present for duty?

elements.title: Landrada of Austrasia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Landrada of Austrasia "was regarded, even as a child, as a model of Christian perfection"?

elements.title: University of Minnesota Messenia Expedition (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the University of Minnesota Messenia Expedition has been described as "the first truly multidisciplinary archaeological expedition in Greece"?

elements.title: Longcat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Longcat was long?
